New Records: Stephen Curry missed his second straight game with a left ankle injury; Andrew Wiggins also sat out consecutive nights due to low back tightness; Trayce Jackson-Davis had 15 points and nine rebounds, shooting 22 for 27 (77.7%) over the first five games
Key Match Events: Golden State jumped to a 20-point lead early the previous night but struggled initially, going 3 for 11 to begin the game; Warriors committed to a 12-man rotation and received contributions from throughout their deep roster
Pre-Game Insights: Golden State exercised the third-year contract option on Brandin Podziemski, who directed the offense with Curry sidelined; New Orleans was without guards CJ McCollum and Herb Jones
Post-Match Reflections: Warriors exercised the third-year contract option on Brandin Podziemski, who finished with 13 points, nine rebounds, and eight assists; Pelicans' Jordan Hawkins played despite earlier back spasms and finished 9 of 21 from the field with four 3-pointers
Miscellaneous Highlights: Pelicans fell behind early and struggled to recover; Zion Williamson was held to 12 points on 5-for-20 shooting; Warriors' next game is against Houston, while Pelicans host Indiana; Warriors' next home game on Nov. 12 will mark Klay Thompson's return with the Mavericks
